content:
TITLE: Implementing Solana Transaction Example
DESCRIPTION: React component demonstrating how to send SOL to a random address using the Wallet Adapter hooks. Includes connection management, transaction creation, and confirmation handling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/anza-xyz/wallet-adapter/blob/master/APP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
import { WalletNotConnectedError } from '@solana/wallet-adapter-base';
import { useConnection, useWallet } from '@solana/wallet-adapter-react';
import { Keypair, SystemProgram, Transaction } from '@solana/web3.js';
import React, { FC, useCallback } from 'react';

export const SendSOLToRandomAddress: FC = () => {
    const { connection } = useConnection();
    const { publicKey, sendTransaction } = useWallet();

    const onClick = useCallback(async () => {
        if (!publicKey) throw new WalletNotConnectedError();

        // 890880 lamports as of 2022-09-01
        const lamports = await connection.getMinimumBalanceForRentExemption(0);

        const transaction = new Transaction().add(
            SystemProgram.transfer({
                fromPubkey: publicKey,
                toPubkey: Keypair.generate().publicKey,
                lamports,
            })
        );

        const {
            context: { slot: minContextSlot },
            value: { blockhash, lastValidBlockHeight }
        } = await connection.getLatestBlockhashAndContext();

        const signature = await sendTransaction(transaction, connection, { minContextSlot });

        await connection.confirmTransaction({ blockhash, lastValidBlockHeight, signature });
    }, [publicKey, sendTransaction, connection]);

    return (
        <button onClick={onClick} disabled={!publicKey}>
            Send SOL to a random address!
        </button>
    );
};
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Solana Wallet Provider Components
DESCRIPTION: React component implementation that sets up the Wallet Adapter context providers, including connection management and wallet selection UI. Configures network endpoint and available wallet adapters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/anza-xyz/wallet-adapter/blob/master/APP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: tsx
CODE:
```
import React, { FC, useMemo } from 'react';
import { ConnectionProvider, WalletProvider } from '@solana/wallet-adapter-react';
import { WalletAdapterNetwork } from '@solana/wallet-adapter-base';
import { UnsafeBurnerWalletAdapter } from '@solana/wallet-adapter-wallets';
import {
    WalletModalProvider,
    WalletDisconnectButton,
    WalletMultiButton
} from '@solana/wallet-adapter-react-ui';
import { clusterApiUrl } from '@solana/web3.js';

// Default styles that can be overridden by your app
import '@solana/wallet-adapter-react-ui/styles.css';

export const Wallet: FC = () => {
    // The network can be set to 'devnet', 'testnet', or 'mainnet-beta'.
    const network = WalletAdapterNetwork.Devnet;

    // You can also provide a custom RPC endpoint.
    const endpoint = useMemo(() => clusterApiUrl(network), [network]);

    const wallets = useMemo(
        () => [
            /**
             * Wallets that implement either of these standards will be available automatically.
             *
             *   - Solana Mobile Stack Mobile Wallet Adapter Protocol
             *     (https://github.com/solana-mobile/mobile-wallet-adapter)
             *   - Solana Wallet Standard
             *     (https://github.com/anza-xyz/wallet-standard)
             *
             * If you wish to support a wallet that supports neither of those standards,
             * instantiate its legacy wallet adapter here. Common legacy adapters can be found
             * in the npm package `@solana/wallet-adapter-wallets`.
             */
            new UnsafeBurnerWalletAdapter(),
        ],
        // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/exhaustive-deps
        [network]
    );

    return (
        <ConnectionProvider endpoint={endpoint}>
            <WalletProvider wallets={wallets} autoConnect>
                <WalletModalProvider>
                    <WalletMultiButton />
                    <WalletDisconnectButton />
                    { /* Your app's components go here, nested within the context providers. */ }
                </WalletModalProvider>
            </WalletProvider>
        </ConnectionProvider>
    );
};
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing a Custom Solana Wallet Connect Button with useWalletMultiButton in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: A complete example of implementing a custom wallet connect button using the useWalletMultiButton hook. The component handles all possible wallet states (no-wallet, has-wallet, connecting, connected, disconnecting) and includes a modal for wallet selection.
SOURCE: https://github.com/anza-xyz/wallet-adapter/blob/master/packages/core/react/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
function CustomConnectButton() {
    const [walletModalConfig, setWalletModalConfig] = useState<Readonly<{
        onSelectWallet(walletName: WalletName): void;
        wallets: Wallet[];
    }> | null>(null);
    const { buttonState, onConnect, onDisconnect, onSelectWallet } = useWalletMultiButton({
        onSelectWallet: setWalletModalConfig,
    });
    let label;
    switch (buttonState) {
        case 'connected':
            label = 'Disconnect';
            break;
        case 'connecting':
            label = 'Connecting';
            break;
        case 'disconnecting':
            label = 'Disconnecting';
            break;
        case 'has-wallet':
            label = 'Connect';
            break;
        case 'no-wallet':
            label = 'Select Wallet';
            break;
    }
    return (
        <>
            <button
                disabled={buttonState === 'connecting' || buttonState === 'disconnecting'}
                onClick={() => {
                    switch (buttonState) {
                        case 'connected':
                            onDisconnect?.();
                            break;
                        case 'connecting':
                        case 'disconnecting':
                            break;
                        case 'has-wallet':
                            onConnect?.();
                            break;
                        case 'no-wallet':
                            onSelectWallet?.();
                            break;
                    }
                }}
            >
                {label}
            </button>
            {walletModalConfig ? (
                <Modal>
                    {walletModalConfig.wallets.map((wallet) => (
                        <button
                            key={wallet.adapter.name}
                            onClick={() => {
                                walletModalConfig.onSelectWallet(wallet.adapter.name);
                                setWalletModalConfig(null);
                            }}
                        >
                            {wallet.adapter.name}
                        </button>
                    ))}
                </Modal>
            ) : null}
        </>
    );
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Solana Wallet Adapter Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Command to install required npm packages for implementing Solana Wallet Adapter in a React application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/anza-xyz/wallet-adapter/blob/master/APP.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm install --save \
    @solana/wallet-adapter-base \
    @solana/wallet-adapter-react \
    @solana/wallet-adapter-react-ui \
    @solana/wallet-adapter-wallets \
    @solana/web3.js \
    react
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing WalletConnectWalletAdapter for Solana in React
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to initialize the WalletConnectWalletAdapter within a React component. It configures the adapter with network settings, a relay URL, project ID, and metadata for the application. This setup enables WalletConnect functionality for Solana wallets in a React application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/anza-xyz/wallet-adapter/blob/master/packages/wallets/walletconnect/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { WalletConnectWalletAdapter } from '@solana/wallet-adapter-walletconnect';

const App = () => {
  ...
  const wallets = useMemo(
      () => [
          new WalletConnectWalletAdapter({
              network,
              options: {
                  relayUrl: 'wss://relay.walletconnect.com',
                  // example WC app project ID
                  projectId: 'e899c82be21d4acca2c8aec45e893598',
                  metadata: {
                      name: 'Example App',
                      description: 'Example App',
                      url: 'https://github.com/anza-xyz/wallet-adapter',
                      icons: ['https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/35608259?s=200'],
                  },
              },
          }),
      ],
      []
  );
  ...
}
```

TITLE: Activating PNPM with Corepack using jq
DESCRIPTION: Command to enable Corepack and prepare the latest version of PNPM by dynamically fetching the current version using jq.
SOURCE: https://github.com/anza-xyz/wallet-adapter/blob/master/BUILD.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
corepack enable
corepack prepare pnpm@`npm info pnpm --json | jq -r .version` --activate
```

TITLE: Cloning the wallet-adapter repository
DESCRIPTION: Git command to clone the wallet-adapter repository from Github to the local machine.
SOURCE: https://github.com/anza-xyz/wallet-adapter/blob/master/BUILD.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/anza-xyz/wallet-adapter.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing project dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Commands to navigate to the project directory and install all dependencies using PNPM package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/anza-xyz/wallet-adapter/blob/master/BUILD.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cd wallet-adapter
pnpm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building all packages in the project
DESCRIPTION: Command to build all packages in the wallet-adapter project using PNPM.
SOURCE: https://github.com/anza-xyz/wallet-adapter/blob/master/BUILD.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
pnpm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the React UI starter locally
DESCRIPTION: Commands to navigate to the React UI starter package, start the development server, and open the application in a web browser.
SOURCE: https://github.com/anza-xyz/wallet-adapter/blob/master/BUILD.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cd packages/starter/react-ui-starter
pnpm run start
open http://localhost:1234
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Activating PNPM with Corepack using a specific version
DESCRIPTION: Command to prepare PNPM with Corepack using a manually specified version number instead of using jq to fetch it.
SOURCE: https://github.com/anza-xyz/wallet-adapter/blob/master/BUILD.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
corepack prepare pnpm@9.1.0 --activate
```
